0,0,0.name: Skate Castle Lobby

directions.alternatives: leave lobby, enter complex

description.defaultDes: You are standing in the lobby of Skate Castle.  Despite being completely empty, the fluorescent lights still dimly light the complex with an unsettling buzz. On the north side of the lobby is the entrance to the rest of the skate complex.
description.basicDes: You are standing in the lobby of Skate Castle.

items.name: Key, keys
items.description: It seems to be made of brass.

actions.actions: Leave building, leave skate castle, leave skate rink, exit, exit building, leave skating rink
actions.response: You just got here!  Stay a while.
actions.fail: A sense of dread overcomes you when you try to leave the building.  You don't know how, but the doors are completely gone.  The doorway in which you entered the building is now flat wall, as if there never were in entrance to begin with.

0,0,0.hint: You can leave the lobby if you would like.

directions.alternatives: enter skate rink, enter rink, go skate rink, go rink
enter locker room, go locker room, go lockers, enter lockers
enter lobby, go to lobby

description.defaultDes: You are in the arcade section of the complex.  Several arcade cabinets and Skee Ball machines line the walls.  Despite the place being abandoned, all of these machines are powered on.  To the east is the public locker room and to the north is the empty skating rink.  To the south is the lobby from which you started.
description.basicDes: You are in the arcade section of the complex.  Several arcade cabinets and Skee Ball machines line the walls. To the east is the public locker room and to the North is the empty skating rink.  To the south is the lobby from which you started.

evos.evoDes: You are in the arcade section of the complex.  All of the game machines have powered down. To the east is the public locker room and to the North is the empty skating rink.  To the south is the lobby from which you started.

items.name: Ticket
items.description: The ticket reads "Admit One" on the front.  On the back you can faintly make out the word "forever" scratched into the paper.

actions.response:
You insert the quarter to play a game.  And for a moment you are able to escape the liminal reality of the desolate complex.  Upon finishing the game, a ticket prints out of the ticket slot and falls to the floor.

A couple seconds after, a loud BANG interrupts the silence of the 'Game Over' screen, and all of the machines in the room power down.
actions.fail: It costs a quarter to play this game.

directions.alternatives: through exit, go through exit, exit, take exit, leave through exit, go through door, exit through door
enter arcade, go arcade, exit arcade, back arcade

description.defaultDes:
You are standing in the middle of the skating rink.  The floor is still covered in thin skid marks left over from the brakes of bygone skaters.  An uneasy feeling washes over you as you consider this place having been so populated at one time, and now being so desolate.  

The entire rink is empty apart from a single "Exit" door on the north side of the floor.
description.basicDes: You are standing in the middle of the skating rink.  The entire rink is empty apart from a single "Exit" door on the north side of the floor.

directions.alternatives: enter arcade, go in arcade, leave locker room, leave lockers

description.defaultDes: You are in the locker room.  The obscure smell of used roller skates combined with old cleaner fills the air.  All of the lockers are unlocked and ajar except for one.
description.basicDes: You are in the locker room.  There is a singular locked locker here.

evos.evoDes: You are in the locker room.  The obscure smell of used roller skates combined with old cleaner fills the air.

items.name: Quarter
items.description: Legal tender for all debts, public, and private.

actions.response: The key is a match and the locker swings open with a slight screech.  A singular quarter rests inside.
actions.fail: A key is required to open this locker.

directions.alternatives: go upstairs, stay upstairs, enter skating rink, enter rink
take exit, go out exit, exit, take the blue pill, exit through door, exit door
go downstairs, go to basement, take stairs, take staircase

description.defaultDes:
You are in the stairwell between the skating rink and the basement area.  An exit door exists here on the West wall.  Above the exit door is a hand written inscription that reads "Take the blue pill and leave here now. DO NOT GO DOWN THE STAIRS."

Your options are apparently limited to going up, going down, or heeding the warning and exiting through the door.
description.basicDes:
You are in the stairwell between the skating rink and the basement area.  An apparent exit door is here.

Your options are limited to going up, going down, or trying to exit the skate complex using the door.

directions.alternatives: go back, go back inside, go inside

evos.evoDes:
You open and step through the door.  You are surrounded entirely by brick walls oversaturated with a bright white light that appears to emanate from an unknown source.  A roughly scratched inscription hangs on the far wall and reads "You were warned, and now you are cursed.  You will be made to crawl on your belly to reach again the light of real day."

Your only option now is to go back through the door on the East wall.

win.description: You take the metaphorical blue pill and leave through the exit door.  You return home and try to forget about the eerie experience of which you just had.  All seems okay, but something inside you says that this won't be the last you've heard from those silent rooms at the Skate Castle.

directions.alternatives: enter hallway, go hallway, take hallway, follow hallway, enter basement
take stairs, go up stairs, take staircase, go up staircase

description.defaultDes: You are at the entrance of the Skate Castle basement.  A small inscription written with some sort of thick black ink reads "You are already past the point of no return - you must follow the white rabbit".   A very long and dimly lit hallway leads to the South.  A staircase leads back to the Skating Rink.
description.basicDes: You are at the entrance of the Skate Castle basement.  A long hallway leads to the South and a staircase leads back to the Skating Rink.

directions.alternatives: go entrance
use elevator, go up elevator, use lift, go in elevator, take elevator, take lift, enter elevator, enter lift
take slide, go down slide, use slide, follow slide, go down slide

description.defaultDes:
The hallway is large and barren except for an obscurely located sofa against the west wall.  There are no doors or windows along the way.  The floor is covered in a thin but vibrant carpet with swirly colorful shapes and tails making up the pattern, reminiscent of movie theater or hotel hallway carpets.  The lights above you are producing the same nauseating buzz that the lights in the upstairs lobby have.

The hallway comes to a stop at the south end with two giant fern bushes on either side of an elevator door.  To the north is the entrance way of the basement.
description.basicDes:
You are in a large hallway with an obscurely located couch on the west side against the wall.

To the south is an elevator between two ferns, and to the north is the entrance way of the basement.

actions.actions: Look elevator, inspect elevator, examine elevator
actions.response: The call button for the elevator points up.  Recalling the upper floor having an absence of any elevator, this detail seems out of place.

actions.actions: Look fern, look ferns, examine fern, examine ferns, inspect fern, inspect ferns, look fern bushes, look fern bush, look bush, look bushes
actions.response: Upon closer inspection, you realize that the ferns are artificial.  They are, however, very convincing.

actions.actions: Move couch, push couch, slide couch, shove couch
actions.response: You push the couch a distance equal to its length.  To your surprise, the entrance to a slide was hidden behind the couch.  You can't exactly see where it leads, but it's clear that it's very dark and steep.

actions.actions: sit on couch, use couch, lay on couch
actions.response: The cushions are worn down and contort to your body perfectly.  You look up and down the hallway and get the feeling that you have been here, and done this... somewhere or sometime in the past.

actions.actions: call elevator, call lift, open elevator, open lift, press button, use button, use call button
actions.response: You press the elevator call button and hear a rumbling from what seems like a very far distance away.  The sound grows louder as the elevator gets closer until finally you hear a "DING", and the doors slide open in front of you.

directions.alternatives: press open, hit open, get out, go out, open door, open
press up, hit up, ascend, up

description.defaultDes: The elevator is bright and roomy.  The back wall is made up of a mirror in which, for a split second before the doors close behind you, you see a horrifying black figure standing way at the other end of the hallway near the basement entrance.  Its large paper-white face is tilted slightly to the side with an ear to ear smile.  It is waving at you.  Is it saying hello or goodbye?  Before you can react, the figure vanishes and then the doors close.  You are inside the elevator.  There are two buttons in the elevator: The 'Up' button and the 'Open' button.
description.basicDes:
The elevator is bright and roomy.  The floor is made of off-white tile, the walls are fake wood panels, the ceiling is made up of fluorescent light panels, and the back wall is a large mirror.  A slight musty smell fills the air.

There are two buttons in the elevator: The 'Up' button and the 'Open' button.

evos.evoDes:
The elevator slowly begins to rise.  For a moment you consider the possibility that you simply missed the existence of an elevator on the ground floor, but this fantasy is quickly dissolved after the elevator persists far longer than it would take to get up the height of the stairs that you came down.

After about 30 seconds of rising into what can only be described as a phantom elevator shaft, the lift comes to a stop, and the door opens.

You are greeted, unfortunately, with a familiar site.  Ahead of you, to the North, is a long hallway.  A couch rests against the wall on the west side, and two ferns are on either side of the elevator.  On the far side of the hallway is the entrance to the basement.  It is clear that, although you definitely felt the elevator rise, you are somehow still in the same place.

For a moment you are too shocked to move, and the doors close in front of you.  You are again left with the choice to press 'Up' or press 'Open'.

You feel the elevator rising again.  After another 30 seconds of very clear upward force, the doors open in front of you.  The basement hallway is, again, still there in front of you.

You are once more left with the choice to press 'Up' or press 'Open' on the elevator.

actions.response: You have a panic attack.  It accomplishes nothing.

actions.actions: press up, hit up, go up, travel up,, ascend, up

description.defaultDes:
You start sliding slow at first, but the slide gets steeper and steeper until, for a moment, you feel as though you are falling straight down.  After a second of freefall, the slide begins to curve in either direction, back and forth, left and right, until finally it completely levels out and brings you to a full stop in a dark room.

You have difficulty seeing in here, but the faint outline of a door can be made out on the other end of the room.
description.basicDes: You are in a dark room.  You remember the mouth of the slide being on one side of the room, and a doorway on the other side of the room.

actions.actions: feel wall, follow wall, feel around, look for light, feel for light, search wall, search for light, search around
actions.response: You follow the wall while feeling around with your hands until finally stumbling upon what feels like a light switch.  It is off.

actions.actions: turn on light, turn on, let there be light, flip switch, flip light, flip light switch, turn it on
actions.response: For a brief moment, nothing happens.  But then the familiar fluorescent buzz begins and the lights above you flicker on.

directions.alternatives: press open, hit open, get out, go out, open door, open
press up, hit up, ascend, up

description.defaultDes:
The elevator slowly begins to rise.  For a moment you consider the possibility that you simply missed the existence of an elevator on the ground floor, but this fantasy is quickly dissolved after the elevator persists far longer than it would take to get up the height of the stairs that you came down.

After about 30 seconds of rising into what can only be described as a phantom elevator shaft, the lift comes to a stop, and the door opens.

You are greeted, unfortunately, with a familiar site.  Ahead of you, to the North, is a long hallway.  A couch rests against the wall on the west side, and two ferns are on either side of the elevator.  On the far side of the hallway is the entrance to the basement.  It is clear that, although you definitely felt the elevator rise, you are somehow still in the same place.

For a moment you are too shocked to move, and the doors close in front of you.  You are again left with the choice to press 'Up' or press 'Open'.
description.basicDes: The elevator is bright and roomy.  The floor is made of off-white tile, the walls are fake wood panels, the ceiling is made up of fluorescent light panels, and the back wall is a large mirror.  A mild musty smell fills the air.

evos.evoDes:
You feel the elevator rising again.  After another 30 seconds of very clear upward force, the doors open in front of you.  The basement hallway is, again, still there in front of you.

You are once more left with the choice to press 'Up' or press 'Open' on the elevator.
